name: Renaissance Casa de Palmas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just stayed in this hotel recently. The overall experience was good. I liked the decor of the hotel. I am not sure if it is a historic building but it is a nice building. We usually stay in other hotels when visiting the Valley but it was a special occasion and we tried this one. Also, we got a very good deal for the weekend. I did not have the chance to try the restaurant but I could see that it is a nice location. I would recommend this hotel for a romantic weekend or if you want to enjoy a nice, and different, hotel experience when in McAllen. It is in a walking distance to downtown (something different to do than going to the shopping malls, etc). The staff was able to accommodate some special requests (it was my wife's b'day). The rooms are small but nice. Note: I read some reviews about people complaining about an odor on the way from the parking lot to the hotel. It is not bad as they said but I would recommend doing something about it (or maybe it is part of the building because it is an old construction). It is on the 83 bus and the main street, so it is easy to drive around and it is located in a quiet neighborhood (a plus was not to have noisy people like in other hotels).
reviews.title: Nice hotel in McAllen

reviews.text: It is a beautiful hotel and the handicap room that we requested was very nice with a view of the courtyard. We ate in the restaurant often and the food was always delicious and served by a friendly staff. An unusual amenity in the lobby was a chilled flavored water (different flavor each day) and a never empty bowl of tiny Tootsie Rolls. (happens to be a favorite of mine) It also seemed to us that the hotel management went out their way to be friendly and helpful....something one usually does not find in a hotel of this size. We look forward to our next trip to Casa De Plaza in McAllen, Texas.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience

reviews.text: Everything is perfect. I like the decoration, the service, the location. There are free garages next to the hotel - very convenient. The staffs are very friendly and helpful, for example, the cleaning staff Cecilia. She went out of her required duty to please guests. I will certainly stay in this hotel whenever i visit McAllen.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in McAllen

reviews.text: One thing the hotel can improve is that the poor breakfast choice. I think they should add some salad, soup bar rather than just bread, eggs, bacon..
reviews.title: Historic Hotel With at Least One Very Small Room

reviews.text: I had the opportunity to spend one night at Casa De Palmas Renaissance hotel in McAllen, Texas when traveling to the area on business. I specifically chose the hotel because of how nice the hotel and rooms looked on Marriott’s web site.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in McAllen, TX

reviews.text: We were visiting very good friends in McAllen and decided to stay at a Renaissance hotel. From the minute we got out of the car, it felt as if we had stepped into paradise.The grounds are simply gorgeous, the sausage trees, flowers and other greenery is breath taking. Walking up to the lobby, takes you through inviting courtyards that offer a very relaxing place to sit and sip a Mimosa or coffee, or cocktail at night. The lobby area is beautiful. There is a reading spot, to cozy up on a loveseat and read a newspaper, or book. They even offer a selection of magazines and books. The bar and it's decor...just perfect! There was no wait to check in, the staff was very helpful and made us feel comfortable and at home. The manager, Matthew Keller, was very gracious and even gave us a tour of the hotel, and told us all about the hotel and it's 95 year history. The room was spacious and inviting. The bedding is so comfortable, didn't want to get up the next morning. The hotel offers turn down service, and leaves chocolates at the bedside. The breakfast buffet offers an assortment of delightful dishes, including pastries, fresh fruit, and the best eggs ever! The lobby also has a pitcher of chilled water that has been infused with fruits, etc. It is very refreshing when coming in from a walk downtown or a day at the pool. (Wish we had remembered to ask for the recipe!!) The pool is beautiful, with lights that change color at night. An awesome view from the balacony of our room. There was construction going on at the hotel, but we did not hear any of it in our room, it did not disrupt us in any way. The hotel offers covered parking, which was is another plus!!! Staying at the Renaissance Casa de Palmas, was wonderful experience, and can't wait to head down there for another visit.
reviews.title: 5 Stars!!! EXCELLENT VACATION

reviews.text: Was visiting a friend of mine in McAllen and decided to stay at a Renaissance hotel. I was pleasantly surprised at the look and feel of the property. The staff was very helpful and made me feel comfortable and at home. It's not often in my travels that I have felt so comfortable when I'm away from home. When I'm back I will not be staying anywhere else. Glad I made the choice to stay here!!
reviews.title: Excellent staff and accomodations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needed to get away this past weekend and chose this hotel. Price was too good to pass up. Well can I pick them. From the minute I walked in I knew it was a good choice. No waiting at check in; nice pleasant clerk; king bedded room that was spotless. I didn't feel like eating in the restaurant for dinner so asked the bartender for a recommendation and he sent me to a fabulous little known place a couple blocks away. Couldn't have been a better evening for us.
reviews.title: What a great weekend

reviews.text: Breakfast was just as big a surprise. Friendly staff, quick service and no pushing to get me out the door. A thoroughly enjoyable weekend......
reviews.title: My stay at Renaissance Casa de Palma

reviews.text: my wife and i spend 4 beautiful days.
reviews.title: Refined Oasis in McAllen
One of my favorite places to stay when away from home
reviews.text: This hotel has a beautiful interior courtyard with a pool and garden. I only drink non-alcoholic beverages and the bartender has always created something special with great taste. Love the rooms. My king bed had 6 pillows instead of the usual 4. They have a great breakfast buffet on the weekends. I would recommend an interior courtyard view room with balcony. These are extra large rooms and well appointed.

To be honest, I wasn't excited about traveling to McAllen. However, the bright-spot was this hotel. It's an old hotel, but very nicely updated. The room was very nice with a comfortable bed. The pool was great, in an enclosed patio area. The bar was nice. If you have to travel to McAllen, give this place a try.
reviews.title: Unexpected Pleasure

reviews.text: It was our first trip to McAllen for a family gathering Casa De Palmas was recommended by a friend who had attended and function at the hotel and spoke very highly of the beauty and service. We were not disappointed rooms were clean and comfortable. The Hotel staff both at the front desk and restaurant were very friendly and inviting. We spend a very relaxing 2 days at this beautiful property. We will certainly stay again and recommend to our friends and family.
reviews.title: Relaxing Stay

reviews.text: Lovely hotel. Staff was very accommodating and had an extra bed ready for our daughter who was staying with us. Beautiful landscape and lovely bar. Parking was also very convenient and we didn't need to drag our suitcases through the lobby.
reviews.title: Beautiful spanish style hotel

reviews.text: Beautiful, well-maintained property. Comfortable and attractive common facilities. Nice, elegant rooms. Very polite and helpful staff. Free parking and reasonable room rates. Well-located in central part of city. Our preferred hotel in town.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: I will never stay here again. Which hurts me, because I loves me some Renaissance hotels. But this one does not look or feel like a Marriott, let alone a Renaissance.
reviews.title: Will NEVER stay here again

reviews.text: I stayed in two rooms during my two-night stay. Neither felt safe or particularly clean.
reviews.title: Regular Guest
Casey
reviews.text: First room smelled musty and, along one wall, also smelled of sewage. Unfortunately, that wall was also the head of the beds, so was that kind of unfortunate. Weird staining on walls, shower curtains, etc, suggested that the hotel is not lovingly cared for.

The next day, I asked for a better room, largely due to security. (The first room was on the first floor, with a door opening onto the common pool area.) I was moved up to the third floor, which sounded promising...until you realized that the doors into the hotel property -- including the ones off of the public parking deck -- remained unlocked until 10:00 pm. Ridiculous.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in the Valley
ants and sewer smell
reviews.text: There was a mistake in the bill, and, an honest error in double booking my room, which caused a man to legitimately walk into my room one evening.

aka: Renaissance Casa De Palmas Hotel Mcallen
description: This historical, full-service luxury hotel originally built in 1918 is located in the heart of the city within walking distance of the entertainment & downtown shopping district. It is conveniently located 2 miles North of McAllen Miller International Airport and La Plaza Mall. The charming hotel combines the magic of yesterday with the conveniences of today offering a rich experience of hospitality, luxury, and comfort; a blend of the old-world and the contemporary unparalleled to any other hotel in the valley. Our full-service hotel features a total of 165 deluxe guestrooms, 24 hour business center, 24 hour state-of-the-art fitness center, on-site restaurant, bar, private club lounge, stunning courtyard pool and up to 6500 square feet of elegant event space.
